Question: This person first traveled to Japan in 1905, where he bought hundreds of prints.
Hints: In 1928, this person wrote an essay on glass in which he compared it to the mirrors of nature: lakes, rivers and ponds.
The only realized skyscraper designed by this person is the Price Tower, a 19-story tower in Bartlesville, Oklahoma.
The work contained more than 100 lithographs of this person's designs and was commonly known as the Wasmuth Portfolio.
